file_content.text: Apparently the Sith are blaming the Hutts for the breach. They're threatening to withdraw from Nar Shaddaa entirely.
Outstanding work! I hear that warehouse is a toxic disaster zone!
My allies among the Hutts say the Sith Lord called them personally, livid about the loss of apprentices.
I can't believe you took out all of them!
I am a Jedi. This is what we train for.
It is my duty.
Glad to have you on my side.
The fewer Sith there are to power it, the weaker the dark side grows.
It is my duty.
In my book, the fewer Sith there are, the fewer Sith there are. And that's worth celebrating.
I'll pit a blaster and superior training against the Force any day.
Sith are overrated.
And you certainly have the skills to back up that claim.
That should earn me bragging rights and a free drink at the next cantina.
I know! Isn't it great?
Brag away. We like to publicize our victories.
How much is it worth to you?
My allies among the Hutts say their Sith Lord was in an absolute fury over the loss of all that technology.
I love to ruin a Sith's day.
Good to know.
Oh, believe me, you did.
There were some things in there I wouldn't want to be looking at across a battlefield.
Glad to help.
You've saved many lives with this action.
I could have found you a buyer for each and every whosit in there.
Such a waste....
The Republic would never forgive me if they turned up in enemy hands.
Do we know what the mystery machine was yet?
What else did you learn?
What do you figure that value is on the open market?
How much is it worth to you?
I'll transfer a payment immediately. The Republic is quite pleased with how you did.
According to the com chatter, you destroyed the only prototype of a device that let the Empire slice our communications from any distance.
Thank you. Though, uh, I suggest you watch your back. The Hutts are not pleased.
Just destroy everything in the warehouse. Every asset we deny them is a win.
Don't look this way and keep your voice down. We shouldn't let anyone see us talking.
I know you have your own reasons for coming to Nar Shaddaa, but maybe you'll postpone them for a few hours for urgent Republic business.
All my business is Republic business.
Of course.
Working here, you almost forget what loyalty looks like.
What's urgent Republic business got to do with me?
Why?
I hear you're worth your price tag on a smash-and-grab.
I never say "yes" until I've got all the details.
That's a bit vague.
Impress me.
How many worlds need to be threatened to make it worth your time?
The Empire's got factories here, weapons and intelligence equipment guarded by all the muscle Hutts can hire.
Our intel says they've got something new--something big.
You want me to destroy it?
And we need to stop it?
Now we're talking. It and everything around it.
You said "intelligence equipment..." Are we talking mirrored helmets that let you see behind you, or orbital lasers?
What is it?
And this is my problem?
How about a little destruction for a good cause?
We can't make a firm ID on the big-money tech yet. We're going to have to hit it all.
There's an Imperial warehouse, top secret, security goons everywhere. We need to destroy everything inside.
When I'm done, all that warehouse will hold is rubble.
I'm in.
Be careful.
There's something you're not telling me.
You're hiding something.
I was getting to it. I just wanted to pique your interest first.
And I get what?
Don't worry. The Republic's got funds for this sort of operation. But you need to be careful.
Whatever this is, it's important enough for a Sith Lord to send a group of his own apprentices to pick it up.
So, you'll need to get in, boom-boom, and out again before they arrive. Unless you fancy taking on a whole gang of Sith.
I don't know about the rest of them, but Sith don't scare me.
I could handle that.
So, you'll need to get in and get out before they arrive. Unless you fancy fighting a bunch of Sith yourself.
Sith don't scare me.
I'm up for it.
Then I bow to you, my friend, because my blood runs cold at the thought.
But make sure your friends agree before you charge. No single person can fight multiple Sith, even apprentices.
But make sure you have backup. Even you can't be everywhere at once.
I'll be careful.
Go quickly, then. My Hutt contacts didn't know when the Sith would be arriving.
Thank you for this service.
Attracting the attention of the Sith would jeopardize my own work.
Count me out. [Refuse quest.]
Then listen for the news nets announcing the latest Imperial conquest.
If you change your mind, tell me. We have no other way to stop this.
I've been waiting for you to come off that speeder.
Stay to this area if you want to be safe. This sector is held by the Empire.
